group_1.narration: "The Azalea House is going to be torn down."
After I overheard that conversation, I told@Hazuki. That's when we decided to help...
We have to stop this from happening!@There has to be something we can do...

group_1.textRight: Director. I'm so sorry, but I overheard@what you were talking about before...

group_1.textLeft: *Chuckle* It's fine.
I was the one who forgot to close the door,@so I can't really blame you...

group_1.textRight: Is there anything we can do to help?
We really don't want to lose this place!
Why is this even being considered?

group_1.textLeft: That's a good question...
Thank you, you two...
Konoha, you really are an honest girl.
And Hazuki, you've always had a kind@heart...
I'll fill you in on what's been happening.
It's actually quite a lot for me to deal@with all by myself... *Chuckle*
This's the situation...

group_1.narration: A new orphanage program was the ulterior@motive to shut down the Azalea House.
It was a then-recent policy where orphans@nationwide would be sent to new orphanages.@They would then receive a new educational@curriculum created along project guidelines.

group_1.textLeft: This place was chosen as one of the first@locations to implement the program...
If that happens, everyone here will be@split up and sent to different homes...

group_1.textRight: And here we were just sitting around@unaware of anything that was going on...

group_1.textLeft: No, don't blame yourself. You girls didn't@do anything wrong.
Besides, we were only chosen for the@program very recently...

group_1.textRight: There's got to be some way we can—

group_1.textLeft: Let's see...
You girls might be able to listen to some of@my complaints when they wear me down.
Don't worry. I can take care of this!
You two carry on just as you always have.
Konoha...
We must make sure everyone stays @together and keeps supporting each other.
You too, Hazuki!

group_1.narration: The director told us not to do anything,@but we were restless...
At least we could look into@the government program online.@That was about all we could do.@When we looked into it, though, we found a@lot of shady rumors surrounding the project.
The policy was getting pushed by@corporate interests and their allies...
And this was something we only found out@later, but the vice director was in on it.@He betrayed us all, secretly working with@the government to tear down Azalea House!
But of course we only learned that...
After the director had fallen ill...
